p: Several reports showed the use of proteomic analysis for investigation of the human dental pulp and most studies analyzed in vitro or ex vivo cultured cells. Very few studies analyzed human dental pulp itself [ 8, 10, 11]. Paakkonen et al. [ 10] identified 96 proteins in pulp from healthy and carious human teeth, and Eckhardt et al. [ 8] detected 342 pulp proteins, including 37 proteins not previously discovered in human dentin or plasma. JÃ¡gr et al. [ 11] compared pulp proteins of sound tooth obtained from caries-resistant versus caries-susceptible individuals and showed that the levels of 16 proteins were significantly different in the caries-resistant group, compared to the susceptible individuals.
